div.l: And groped here and there but she fond noone
Alas qᵈuod she I had almost mysgone
I had almost gon to the clerkes bedde
Ey bn̄enedicite þan haddde I foule y spedde
And forth she goth til she the cradell fonde
She gropeth alwey forther with her honde
And fonde the bedde and thoght noȝt but goode
Bycaus that the cradell by hyt stoode
And nyst where she was for hit was derk
But fair and wele she crepe to the clerk
And lith full stille ⁊and wolde haue caught a slepe
With in a while this Iohn the clerk vp lepe
And on this good wyfe he leith on sore
So mery fitte ne hadde she not full yore
He pryketh harde ⁊and depe as he were madde
This ioly lyf han these two clerkes ladde
Till that thridde cokke bygan to synge
Alen wexe wery in the dawenyng
For he hadde swonken̄ all the long nyght
And seid fare wele malyn swete wight
The day is cōmmyn I may no lenger byde
But euermore where so I go or ryde
I am thyn owne clerk so haue I hele
Now dere lēmman qᵈuod she go far͗e wele
But or thow go oone thyng I will the telle
Whan that þow wendest homeward by the melle
Ryght at the entre of the dore behynde
Thow shalt a cake of half a busshell fynde
That was ymaked of thyn owne mele
Whiche that I helpe my syre for to stele
And good lēmman god the save ⁊and kepe
And with that worde almost he gan to wepe
Alen vp ryst and thoght or hit were day Added to facilitate collatio
